column1: Symptoms may include: - Abdominal pain - Coma - Confusion - Internal (stomach and intestinal) bleeding - Slowed breathing - Slurred speech - Stupor (decreased level of alertness) - Unsteady walking - Vomiting, sometimes bloody - Chronic alcohol overuse can lead to additional symptoms and multiple organ failure.

The person may receive: - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation),and ventilator (breathing machine) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - CT (computerized tomography, or advanced imaging) scan - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through the vein (intravenous or IV) - Medicines to treat symptoms
